The Stepdown Ledger

I am Lenny Pike, former municipal staircase inspector, current editor, and the woman who watched Stair 11 eat my wedding cannoli in 2004. I am not over it. Neither should this nation be.

Front Page Emergency

City Hall spent $78,000 repainting steps "less intimidating beige." We asked for ramps. They sent us a color swatch named "Compliance Oat." This is why I publish six times a week.

"If a surface requires counting before use, it's infrastructure cosplay."

ALERT: Residents of Block C report three consecutive "decorative" steps near a frozen yogurt shop. Deploying pamphlets and one very loud clipboard.

We do not negotiate with nostalgia. If your staircase has a family crest, that is not compliance.

Correction #882

In Monday's issue, we described the museum staircase as "smug." Legal requested "architecturally condescending." Updated.

Correction #883

We misspelled Councilmember Brigg's quote "we hear your concerns" as "we fear your concerns." Our typo was emotionally accurate.

Both. We hate avoidable barriers and the little grin steps seem to wear when people pretend they're "historic charm."

Rampsy the Raccoon once stole my measuring tape and returned it sorted by inch. Leadership qualities.

Yes. Accountability starts at home. We offer a gentle "renovate, don't self-flagellate" checklist.
